temporary.title: Temporary Status
temporary.desc: Subsidiary protection is granted for one year initially and can be renewed if conditions in your home country remain dangerous. You must apply for renewal before your status expires.

work.title: Limited Work Access
work.desc: You can work but may need additional permits for certain jobs. Some employment programs may have restrictions. Check with employment services about specific requirements for your situation.

healthcare.title: Healthcare Access
healthcare.desc: You have access to essential healthcare services including emergency treatment, basic medical care, and mental health services. Coverage may be more limited than for refugees.

family.title: Family Reunification
family.desc: Family reunification is possible but may take longer and have more restrictions than for recognized refugees. Income and housing requirements may be stricter.

checklist.renew: Remember to renew your status before expiry
checklist.documents: Keep all official documents safe and updated
checklist.legal: Seek legal advice if your situation changes
